name: 096 Labeled axis, improved financial series
body:
First of all, sorry for the delay in this release, besides the fact that I needed a break, this time was also useful to analyze some of the current issues of the library, I was able to play with the geared package, and make significant performance improves, I'll soon update the site with the tips I found.

### What is next for the library?

* WPF 1.0 will come soon, I am aware of a couple of significant issues in the library, I'll fix before releasing 1.0
* UWP will be updated to support all the features WPF does.
* Documentation will have a considerable review based on the most asked questions I've received along the life of this library.

###  When will it happen?

I am planning to accelerate the process, this moth I will be working hard in the project, ETA to achieve all previous points, 45 days.

<hr/>

Lets go back to this release:

### Braking Changes

 * Sadly in a previous release, Series.PointForeground property was renamed by mistake to Series.PointForeround (notice the missing 'g'), this release fixes this typo error.

### New Features

* This repo now includes the assemblies certificate, this will allow anyone to build a singed copy of LiveCharts by only running build.ps file, yes the same certificate that signs the assemblies in Nuget.
* Labeled Sections, notice it supports 2 modes, in the X axis, the section snaps to the closest point, in the Y axis it just follows the mouse position (Sample [here](https://github.com/beto-rodriguez/Live-Charts/tree/master/Examples/Wpf/CartesianChart/SectionsMouseMove), will be in the site soon):

![snap](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10853349/25369615/d8ed8f3e-294a-11e7-82c4-b1200059525c.gif)

* Advanced coloring rules for financial series, supported in both, LiveCharts and LiveCharts.Geared, a sample will be uploaded to the site soon.

* An experimental new axis thanks to @mirthestam, this axis, changes its labels according to user zooming and panning, changing from years, month, days, hours and seconds. https://github.com/beto-rodriguez/Live-Charts/tree/master/Examples/Wpf/CartesianChart/DateAxis

### Fixed issues

* Prevents a possible threading issue https://github.com/beto-rodriguez/Live-Charts/commit/faef6696e7415b04634f49721dda9a2da5267ded.
* Fixed an issue where replacing an item in a ChartValues instance was not firing the update automatically https://github.com/beto-rodriguez/Live-Charts/commit/29f9f426cb319c204ca75e7a51f5c065b5f2c77b.
* Fixes an issue where scroll bars could get lost when mouse up event was triggered outside the chart https://github.com/beto-rodriguez/Live-Charts/commit/ca11434f85f0d3cd7e9ee2339422228b91046884.
* Fixed an issue where nesting a chart inside a Winforms user control could cause the designer to throw https://github.com/beto-rodriguez/Live-Charts/commit/7afe71b7a4771b9234ed2c49a1151a2b2e46a19e.
* #499 
* Fixed a visual bug with missing points in a LineSeries https://github.com/beto-rodriguez/Live-Charts/commit/d928f17626c5498786800da706a37d3ee29d5a9f
* #515 Windows7/WindowsXP zooming issue

### Extra Notes

* Axis.Separator type changed from IAxisSeparator to LiveCharts.WPF.Separator/LiveCharts.UWP.Separator this should improve developers' experience avoiding an unnecessary cast.

name: 094 Smoother Panning
body:
**No Major Changes**

**New Features**

* Now we have a smoother panning, panning refreshes the chart as you move your mouse, not only when the MouseUp event is called (as it used to):

![pan hold](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10853349/23734999/86e09e60-0448-11e7-8c33-9c59514643da.gif)

* New Column/Row series property, the SharesPosition property, by default when you have multiple bar series in the library each bar is placed side by side, setting this property to false you can make similar plots to:

![sharesposition](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10853349/23735546/d578e318-044b-11e7-83f0-966357f6a421.png)

* now we can use this library to generate images that were not in the UI #415, sample [here](https://github.com/beto-rodriguez/Live-Charts/blob/master/Examples/Wpf/CartesianChart/Chart%20to%20Image/ChartToImageSample.xaml.cs)

**Fixed issues**

* Fixed an issue where zooming and panning was not working properly when the chart had multiple axes.
* Fixed an issue that caused WPF designer to throw when a chart had multiple axes.
* Removed a memory leak when using data templates in the library (when removing an item) #457 
* Fixed poosible NRE when using HeatMaps #477 
* Fixed an issue with color interpolation in GeoHeatMap control #472 
* Fixed an issue where Scatter and Financial series were not scaling properly #483 
* A better Axis object, improves labeling for some cases #449

name: 0935 small patch for 093 version
body:
An annoying visual issue introduced in 0.9.3, here is the patch 

**Fixes**
- #460 

**New features**
- New Separator.ActualStep property, it is a read only property, here you can find the current axis separator step even when you didn't set it.

name: 093 We are thread-safe now!
body:
The library was not working properly when updates came multiple threads, now it handles it as it always should...

**No changes** in this release, I keep working to release 1.0 in WPF.

The geared package version 1.2.2 will be released in the next couple of hours, 0.9.3 also was updated to connect properly with the geared package...

**New features**
- Now we can use the Axis.ActualMinValue and Axis.ActualMaxValue properties to read the limits of an axis, even if we didn't set them similar to the way we work with ActualWidth/ActualHeight properties from WPF framework...
- Axis.BarUnit property is obsolete, instead please use Axis.Unit property, this property is now more important and fixed a couple of special cases... I'll add an article in the site about it

**Fixed issues**

#347
#336
#449

name: 092 Pie charts needed some love...
body:
Trying to solve all the open issues to release v1.0...

##if you are using the geared values package, please don't update to this version yet, soon the next version for the geared package will be released, and it will connect properly with livecharts 0.9.2

**No Changes**

well, tooltips are cleaner now, there was a case ( #229 ) where you needed to wrap your tooltip in a container to make it work properly, this is no longer necessary, tooltips should display correctly always now.

**New Features**
- Now DataLabels can be more than only strings, you can pass your own DataTemplate and render anything you need there, see #414 
- Now we can customize the position of the labels in a pie chart, see #296 
- PieSeries has better animations and labels positioning.

**Fixed issues**
- Fixed an issue where adding a new axis could throw an exception
- #384 
- #454

name: 091 Performance safe zooming
body:
No changes in this version, the library feels now really solid and stable in my opinion, I have been fixing the most annoying issues in the library the couple of last releases, things are close to release v 1.0, next things to fix before releasing 1.0 are pie charts and maps. 

**New Features**
- Now we can disable zooming and enable panning or vise versa
- ChartValues now implements INotifyCollectionChanged and INotifyPropertyChanged, which means this class now updates the UI and not only the chart as it used to for more info see #284

**Fixed issues**
- Fixed an issue where animated zooming was not queuing the request in the updater, this caused the chart to redraw every time we scrolled the mouse wheel, now animated zoom behaves much better.
- #444
- #284 (partially, I reopened)
- #448 
- #431 
- #443

name: 090 Logarithmic Axes, Events as commands, and fixed reported issues
body:
This release has no significant code changes, this means that the is a low probability to introduce new bugs (please don't),  it fixes many old issues that required a detailed review.

**Breaking Changes**
- Chart.UpdaterTick delegate changed from `void UpdaterTickHandler()` to `void UpdaterTickHandler(object sender)` where sender is the chart that fired the event.

**New Features**
- Default tooltip for CartesianChart had a considerable visual improvement, it is also much more flexible, the article about tooltips in the site will be updated showing the new features
- Finally one of the ugliest issues (in my opinion) was fixed, series were not able to let the chart know its points size, this caused points to be not completely rendered, see #341 
- You can now bind any event in the library, there will be a new article in the web site about events, listing them all and showing a brief example.
- New Logarithmic Axis, now you can add logarithmic axes with any base to a  cartesian chart.
- Gauges are much more flexible. the site will show a new article with the new gauge capabilities.

**Fixed issues**
- Fixed an issue where HeatAlgorithm color interpolation method was not working correctly if the weight min value was not zero.
- Fixed an issue where angular gauge was trying to draw multiple separators depending on the gauge range, the gauge range.
- #341, #352, #338, #330, #42, #20

name: 081 Maintenance release
body:
This release fixes many reported issues, thanks everyone for reporting.

**New Features**
- now you can rotate labels in Column, Row, StackedColumn and StackedRow series #410 
- new DataHover event #416 

**Fixes**
- line series was not drawn properly when Visibility == Hidden #403
- Fixed many visual issues with LineSeries and double.Nan introduced in 0.8
- Changing windows theme throws an exception #372 
- Gauge throw when from and to == 0 #420 
- Throw when playing with animations and data labels #321 
- Row series with negative values were not displayed properly #401 
- Issue where we were not able to specify the axis range when using any stacked series #405 
- Casting error in OHCL series #411 
- Binding Separators not updating properly when changed #412

name: 080 Welcome UWP :tada:
body:
0.8.0 is a really important release, it demonstrates that the structure of the library is solid enough to take it to more platforms, and here it is the first step **welcome UWP!** 🎉, you are next Xamarin! special thanks to @AuroraDysis who made most of the work taking LiveCharts to UWP.

This version has small, but braking changes, coming from 0.7.x should not require any change in most of the cases:

**New Features**
- **Welcome UWP** the library is finally in UWP, with some known issues that you can find in the [Issues section](https://github.com/beto-rodriguez/Live-Charts/issues), the package is already in Nuget: `PM> Install-Package LiveCharts.Uwp`
- **welcome back net 4.0** wrongly I removed support to net 40 in previous versions, well now it is back, the Nuget package contains both builds net4.0 and PCL profile 328 (current one).
- For some reason all the nuget packages missed `.pdb`, and xml docs files, they are now included since 0.8, this in makes the library more friendly to users, by enabling IDE intellisense and a better debugging experience.
- LiveCharts.Geared v1.2 will be released soon, which extends the high performance to all the series in the library (but heat series).
- **new Gantt chart** see an example there -> https://github.com/beto-rodriguez/Live-Charts/tree/master/Examples/WinForms/Cartesian/GanttChart
- Wpf themes are included now in the library, they are light and an easy way to get started styling your charts : https://lvcharts.net/App/examples/v1/wpf/Themes

**Major Changes** (don't be scared to update, normally they won't affect your current work)
- Type of `Axis.MinValue` and `Axis.MaxValue` changed from `double?` to `double` to fix incompatibility with UWP, in older version o clear zooming you used to `axis.MinValue = null`, the equivalent in 0.8 is `axis.MinValue = double.Nan`, the example in the web site is already updated to 0.8 API
- `Section.FromValue` and `Section.ToValue` are obsolete and will be replaced in future versions with `Section.Value` and `Section.SectionWidth` to fix a bug with draggable sections, FromValue/ToValue works, but there is no warranty that it will be supported in future versions, if you are using a draggable section please use the new properties instead, the site already contains examples using the new syntax.

**Fixed issues**
- #275 
- #381 
- #397 
- #328

name: 0717 GearedValues
body:
High Performance is finally here, please see https://lvcharts.net/App/examples/v1/wpf/Improve%20Performance

**Fixed issues** 
- Fixed an issue where step line series was not setting PointForeground properly
- Improves Hovering performance in Line and StepLine series

name: 0716 fixing issues
body:
No Major changes

**Fixes**
- #342 
- #344 
- Fixes an issue when dragging section could throw when zooming was enabled.

name: 0715 Dragable sections
body:
No major changes

**Fixed bugs**
- #339 
- #340 

**New Features** 
- Now you can drag sections , find an example [here](https://github.com/beto-rodriguez/Live-Charts/tree/master/Examples/Wpf/CartesianChart/SectionsDragable)
- Now you can control the ZIndex of sections, link above also uses this feature
  ![dragables](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10853349/18936496/6860f8be-85ad-11e6-81f8-657d012346ab.gif)

name: 0714 Ready for HP
body:
As the last releases this one has no changes, it fixes some issues, and it is ready to connect with the high performance package of the library, it took me really too much time, but it is here and should be online in no more than 2 days.

### Fixes
- #329 
- #317 
- #326 
- #334

name: 0713 An emergency release
body:
- "Fixes" #312 
- Fixes #320 

This release has also a better implementation for `Axis.RangeChanged` event

name: 0712 High Performance coming soon
body:
This release has no significant changes, just new features and fixed issues.

I said 0.7.12 would include High performance, sadly not everything is ready yet. the library in general is much more solid to do complex operations, you will notice it, many improvements to zooming, panning, and detected bottlenecks that were reducing performance.

This does not means the library is read to plot millions of points now, I keep working in the virtualization algorithms,  the results are awesome, you can really plot millions in practically no time (depends on the series and chart). These algorithms are practically ready, but before releasing them I need to fix licensing and some other issues, as I have said they will have a price, but you will be able to get a license from 59 USD, this is a really low price compared with any other charting library, this will only help to keep the project alive, pay the web site, improve documentation and support.

Live-Charts will always be free and MIT licensed, this means if you only need what you have being doing so far, you won't need to pay anything to use this library, but when you need a high performance library you could t get the `GearValues` package.

Let's go back to this release

**New Features**:
- New property, `Axis.BarUnit`, it makes much more simpler to work with bars, instead of [changing the unit of the chart](http://lvcharts.net/App/examples/v1/wpf/Date%20Time) as you used to, I will add an example to the web site soon, but the idea is that now you can set the width of a column bar, to 1 second, 1 day, or any unit you need.
- New `Axis.RangeChanged` event, this even is called every time the axis range changes, includes zooming and panning, also will add an example soon.

**Fixed issues**
- #285 
- #316 
- #269

name: 0711 GeoMaps, Scatter series & StepLineSeries
body:
This release introduces some new features, specially a really important one, the GeoMaps control, also fixes some issues.

**Major Changes**
- BubbleSeries was renamed to ScatterSeries, BubblePoint was also renamed to ScatterPoint, it is also easier to customize, see http://lvcharts.net/App/examples/v1/wpf/Scatter%20Plot

**New Features**
- GeoMap Control http://lvcharts.net/App/examples/v1/wpf/GeoHeatMap
- StepLineSeries http://lvcharts.net/App/examples/v1/wpf/Step%20Line
- Column.LabelsPosition property, it helps you to specify where labels should be placed in a bar see #281 
-  Extended pending controls to winforms, Angular Gauge and CartesianChart.VisualElements property
- Some new and useful properties and extensions, such as Chart.ConvertToPixels(), Chart.ConvertToChartValues() and Series.Points property

**Fixed issues**
- #293 
- #271

name: 0710 Fixes NRE in 079
body: Forgot to run unit tests in 079 release (sorry), this release is a cleanup of 079.

body:
Not much, it is now easier to create custom tooltips and legends

name: 0.7.4 Heat Series
body:
This release introduces 2 new features #218 Bullet Style, and #161 heat maps

I was working in a script to keep documentation updated, it is finished, sadly the hosting company is facing some issues and the site documentation section is not working correctly

**Changes**
- **New** property, use Series.Geometry to specify a custom shape for any point, [example](http://lvcharts.net/App/examples/v1/wpf/Basic%20Line%20Chart), Notide there is a default class holding many shapes, the DefaultGeometries class
- **New** you can now add HeatSeries to a cartesian chart, [example](http://lvcharts.net/App/examples/v1/wpf/Heat%20Series)
- Series.PointDiameter was renamed to Series.GeometrySize, because now we have more than points.
- Chart.Hoverable property is back, now you can have charts without tooltips and hover animations, or viceversa., see #198, #206
- BubbleMapper class was renamed to WeightedMapper, because now 2 series use it, Bubble series, and HeatSeries

**Fixed Issues**
- #198 
- #206
- #180 
- #223

**Important**

Support for .net 4.0 was dropped, the nuget binaries starts at 4.0.3, for more info see [#212](https://github.com/beto-rodriguez/Live-Charts/issues/212)

**Changes**
- Rotating lables is more simple and cleaner and better, see #214 
- Changed LiveCharts.Wpf.Charts.Chart.Chart to LiveCharts.Wpf.Charts.Base.Chart

**Fixes Issues**
- #203 
- #211  
- #202 
- #208 
- #215 
- #213 (need to wait for WinForms release)
- #189

name: 0.7.2.2 Support for UI Elements
body:
Thanks every one reporting the issues you have found, this version mainly fixes the most important or annoying reported issues, there is also one "new" ("new" because it is only new in 0.7) feature, you can now add any ui element to the chart.

**Changes**
- The AxisX and AxisY properties are no longer of type `List<Axis>` instead it is a specialized collection the `AxesCollection` type, you would normally don't need to change any part of your code, at least I didn't, only if you were initializing an axis set from code behind, you must change `myChart.AxisX = new List<Axis>()` to `myChart.AxisX = new AxesCollection()` 

**New Features**
- Now you can add any UI element to a chart, this was already supported in older versions, but now it is more MVVM friendly, [here](https://github.com/beto-rodriguez/Live-Charts/blob/master/Examples/Wpf/CartesianChart/UIElements/UIElementsExample.xaml) is an example 
- Now there is a new property for the default tooltip and default legend, the `BulletSize` property, use it to increase the size of the bullet in both, I also by default increased the size in both, from 11 to 15, it really looks much better, [here](https://github.com/beto-rodriguez/Live-Charts/issues/199#issuecomment-225273375) is an example.
- Based on #190, you can now custom the padding between each bar series (Rows, Columns and both stacked versions), so now you can build histograms with this library.
- The `Chart.Update()` method is back, it is not recommended to use this method, LiveCharts should ALWAYS update by itself, but there are some specific scenarios where you need to force the updater.

**Fixed Issues**
- #194 Pie Chart was not working in winforms.
- #193 Removing an axis instance, was not removing the drawn shapes of the instance.
- #185 Fixed a bug where DataTooltip was clipped, when the chart was not big enough.
- #195 Fixed a bug where the colors in the gauge where inverted.

name: 0.7.1 Building all Examples with 0.7.0
body:
0.7.0 was a huge design change, I was updating the site, and building the examples with 070 sadly not all features were working correctly, this version fixes many bugged features...
- Improved web site examples, it is not finished yet, but I built every major feature with 071 version and everything is running correctly as far as I could see, I am building a quick guide to find rapidly what you need http://lvcharts.net/App/Index#/examples/wpf/start
- Fixed an accessibility error for `Charting.For<T>;`, it was private instead of public.
- **New** now you can rotate axis labels http://lvcharts.net/App/Index#/examples/v1/wpf/About%20Labels
- Fixed a bug where using this syntax was throwing an exception `<lvc:LineSeries Values="{Binding MyValues}" />`
- Fixed a bug where row series were not displayed correctly
- Fixed a bug where row seres were not plotting correctly when mixing series types

name: 0.7.0 A mature version
body:
Currently LiveCharts supports most of features that other charting libraries does, with our own benefits, this release integrates correctly all the features included a long the life of the library, I practically reviewed every corner of the code, you must find this version really stable and maintainable, the migration to 0.7.0 should be really easy and should make the library much more easier to use, there are a lot of automatic stuff now.

Everything included in previous versions works, now it is much much more easier!

**What problems does 0.7.0 solves?**
- **Multiplaform**, yes, you will soon see this library in more platforms, now the core of the library is a PCL.
- **1 chart, multiple series**, the only big change in this version is that the `BarChart` or `StackedBarChart` classes are removed, now we only have one chart the `Cartesian Chart` this chart supports all the series in previous versions an many new ones, and yes you can mix any Series.
- **Full Review of the code**, When I made the library portable I had to split all the current code in Model (Core) and View (WPF in this case), this forced me to review ALL the code, you must find a much more solid structure in the library, fixed many old code blocks that are no more necessary, and were causing confusing and repetitive issues.
- **ChartValues<T> now is for real generic.** Forget about the configuring a type to plot it, the library already knows how to plot many types, you could also plot any custom type as in previous versions. 
- **Easier Configuration** When you really need to plot a custom class then configuring it is much easier, [here](https://github.com/beto-rodriguez/Live-Charts/blob/master/Core/Charting.cs) You know only need to configure the type once, then the library will use this config everywhere in you application, you can override this config for specific cases, as you used to in previous versions.

**Migration from older versions**

It should be easier, many things changed but most of them internally, you should find the migration to 0.7 pretty easy.
I don't remember remember If I renamed any property (I am sorry this was a HUGE release), but I think I didn't, please let me know if you are facing any troubles besides these ones migrating to 0.7.0
- No more BarChart, StackedBarChart, now we only have one chart CartesianChart, this chart supports all the old series and much more!
- Now the nuget package `Install-Package LiveCharts` contains only the core of the library, you must also install the platform view for example for wpf `Install-Package LiveCharts.Wpf`
  - `SeriesConfiguration` class is now obsolete and will be removed in future versions, instead use `LiveCharts.Configurations.Mappers` class, it contains a list of configurators, the equivalent to `SeriesConfigurations` class is `Mappers.Xy`.
- `Hoverable` property is now obsolete, and will be removed in future versions, if you need to disable the tooltip, instead set a null tooltip, `Chart.DataTooltip = null;`
- `Chart.XCursor` is much better, instead there is a new property in the axis `Axis.Sections`, you can highlight one or many value ranges, [here](https://github.com/beto-rodriguez/Live-Charts/blob/f055a6ae62196f6656481978ae654461f879b82e/Examples/Wpf/CartesianChart/SectionsExample.xaml) is an example.

**New Features**
- High Frequency updates
- BubbleSeries
- StackedArea Series
- OhclSeries (Financial Series)
- All Stacked Series have a new property `StackMode`, the options are Values or Percentage.
- PieSeries has a new property, the `PushOut` property allows you to highlight a pie slice.
- New Gauge control
- Now the axis have a new property, Axis.Sections, it is an array of `Section` class, you can highlight value ranges

**Fixed Issues**
- #92 Unknown point (Double.Nan) and line charts fails when you change a point from double.nan to double
- #105 Chart not drawing when I do constant changes in a short period or time (less than 100ms).
- #91 Live changes failing sometimes (not sure when already) 
- #132  When char width is too smal error jump up. I'm about Basic Line 
- #145 LineChart, first point start a bezier line from 0.0 
- #130 PieChart only works with double values
- #131 sometimes when mouse click with no intention, may cause some problem
- #143 binding to a serie with twice the same coordinates points fail
- #115 Measuring Cursor for Chart Axis 
- #79 Add more charts 
- #128 Legend is not displayed

Some images:

![constant changes](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10853349/15451980/1bf8b482-1fa3-11e6-8945-e0e08f33a347.gif)
![multiax](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10853349/15451981/1d37d0e4-1fa3-11e6-8c79-825f580f6819.png)
![gauges](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10853349/15451982/2041fb7a-1fa3-11e6-9d25-4471c09b3cb2.gif)
![buubles8](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10853349/15452005/2792e230-1fa4-11e6-8bd3-5aed219d3256.gif)

name: 0.6.7 Small performance review
body: 0.6.5 and 0.6.6 reduced drastically the performance for line chart this release fixes line series performance issues, also fixes zooming and panning. using Chart.DisableAnimations = true and Chart.Hoverable= false will increase drastically the performance of a line chart. there is a new CursorX and CursorY property set the Cursor.X.Value = 10 to highlight X = 10 set it to null to remove the highlight Becuase of 0.6.5 and 0.6.6 zooming and paning is magically animated :smile: this gif summarizes the fixes:

name: 0.6.6 The Axis Release
body:
A **must have** release, 0.6.5 was visually good but unstable compared with 0.6.4, 0.6.6 fixes most of reported bugs, and has many new features.

0.6.6 finally caches every object, it never deletes and adds a new object as previous versions used to, this is taking LiveCharts to a new level, performance should be drastically improved, and animations run much better since we always animate from where the chart was in the previous frame.

**New Features**
1. multi axes charts from #21, even the declaration of the AxisX and AxisY property changed the XAML syntax should work as in previous versions, if you set an Axis from code behind then you will need to change your code. You can find examples at https://github.com/beto-rodriguez/Live-Charts/tree/master/WPFExamples/Line%20Examples/InLine or https://github.com/beto-rodriguez/Live-Charts/tree/master/WPFExamples/BarExamples/MultiAxesBarChart or  http://lvcharts.net/#/examples/v1/multipleAxes-wpf?path=WPF-MultipleAxes (final link could not be updated yet), **Note:** The Chart.Axis property changed its definition, from `public Axis AxisX {get;set;}` to `public List<Axis> AxisX {get;set;}` conciser this if you are some how manipulating the axes in code behind eg: `chart.AxisX = new List<Axis> { new Axis() };`
2. Introduced some new properties to handle multi axes charts, **1)** use the `Series.ScalesYAt` or `Series.ScalesXAt` to indicate that a series uses certain axis. **2)**us the `Series.CurrentXAxis` or `Series.CurrentYAxis` to get the current axis of a series.
3. You can now custom yous axis positioning, no mater if you have 1 or 10 axes you could specify where the axis is stacked (Top/Right or Bot/Left), use the `Axis.Position` property to custom this.

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10853349/14399579/8cad3494-fdb3-11e5-8272-43755b9be25d.png)
1. You can now "merge" axes to the plot area, this will save some space, also will make your charts look more math style, just set the `Axis.IsMerged` property to True, the image to the left shows a merged axis vs a normal axis(right)

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10853349/14399794/dfda95b0-fdb5-11e5-8504-6df683434e1b.png)
1. yo can now place multi lines labels for more info see #99 
2. You have now more control over series, some properties extra properties are directly binded to the Drawn shape, for example in any series set Panel.ZIndex property, this way you will be able to control the Z order of your chart, for more info see #107 
3. All series stroke can be dashed now, for more info see #116 
4. Added the new Chart.TooltipTimeout property so yo can custom the duration of a tooltip when the user leaved the data point. please see #118 
5. Axes are now animated, when the chart grows or reduces it values range you will see how the chart animates this.

**Fixed Bugs**

#104, #98, #106, #100, #108, #102, #101 

**Extra notes**

Stacked bar chart, and Radar charts are not working for 0.6.6, they will be added again when all features (Zoom, panning and high performance) are ready for Pie, Bar and Line charts.

name: 0.6.5 Animations improved
body:
Animations are really nice now, in previous version animations were only supported when the chart was drawn, now every time you make a change all chart animates from current to new state.

new web site with better examples and documentation

### http://lvCharts.net

**Major Changes**
- Removed LineType property, instead there is a new property called LineSmoothness which gives you more control over the line, it goes from 0 (rect lines) to 1 (really curved line).
- When Implementing IObservableChartPoint, renamed event ValueChanged to PointChanged
- Renamed chart.Redraw() to Chart.Update()
- Renamed Chart.UnsafeRedraw() to Chart.UnsafeUpdate()
- Renamed Axis.Thickness to Axis.StrokeThickness
- Pie Chart now supports multiple series, please see new examples, 0.6.4 syntax will not work as you expect, pie chart is also more concistent and should work the same as all charts now.

name: 0.6.4 ObservablePoints
body:
**Major Changes**
- Renamed Property `DataToolTip` to `DataTooltip`
- Zoom is much more smarter and changed `Zoom` property type from `bool` to an enum where options are `None`, `XY`, `X` and `Y` see this example for more info go to https://github.com/beto-rodriguez/Live-Charts/tree/master/WPFExamples/HighPerformance

**New Features**
- Now live charts handle obvervable points, this means you can update your chart when a property changes, see example here https://github.com/beto-rodriguez/Live-Charts/tree/master/WPFExamples/BarExamples/UsingObservableChartPoint
- Now Series have a new property called `DataLables` set it to true when you need in line labels, example:

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10853349/12802885/af48e358-caab-11e5-8002-f3ce2667a72a.png)
- New `DefaultAxes` class, now it is easier to create a new class from XAML, see https://github.com/beto-rodriguez/Live-Charts/blob/master/WPFExamples/Line%20Examples/IrregularIntervals/IrregularLine.xaml

**Fixed Bugs**
- Added new UnitTests, this should help with more stable future versions
- Added more support to PieCharts with #81 #85 #80 also better examples for pie charts.
- #84 Now you can change Series Visibility
- now all charts are more stable, added unit testing project and removed many double.NaN bugs from all charts.

name: 0.6.3 No changes but Nuget configuration
body: Fixed a bug where if your target framewrok was 4.6 Nuget package was not installing correctly

name: 0.6.2 Back to Basics
body:
I received some mails and comments telling me that LiveCharts was hard, and they were right in the processes of improving this library I got lost and suddenly everything was complicated, so this release practically is just to make things clear again, without losing all the improvements we have built.

There are practically no major changes in this release, but one Scatter chart disappears, why? Because with 0.6 line and scatter chart are practically identical, so we merge them, now it’s easier to build scatter charts, and have better examples.

name: 0.6.1 cleaner and faster code
body:
**New Features**
- #33 
- #42 
- #72 
- #9 

**Fixed bugs**
- #63 
- #80 
- #75
- #69
- #64
- #76

**Other Issues resolved**
- #48 
- #73

**Major changes**
- Now "SeriesViewers" are called Legends, it is a global name with another charting libraries.
- Now you dont create a new control fo legends, now you only set to a valid position the property LegendLocation, for more info see #63 
- Changed default name space (Again) from lvc to LiveCharts

name: 0.6.0 Generics Ploting!
body:
This is a must have release, close to 10,000 lines changed, the most important changes are:
- Now you don’t plot an `ObservableCollection<double>`, instead you plot `ChartValues<T>` where `T` is anything you need, Tooltips also can display `T` instead of a double value,  This is an awesome feature I am really glad with the result, see an example here: https://github.com/beto-rodriguez/Live-Charts/tree/master/ChartsTest/Line%20Examples/Mvvm.
- Default Namespace changed for simplicity in XAML from `LiveChart` to `lvc`
- You can safely remove SeriesCollection wrapper needed for 0.5.9 and 0.5.10
- Pie chart now support tooltip by default.
- Implemented many specialized classes that might help in a future (and now) with performance, stability and scalability for example  `ChartValues`,  `SeriesCollection`,  `ChartPoint`
- Renamed PrimaryValues to Values, SecondaryValues for scatter chart dissapear, now ScatterChart uses by default `ChartValues<Point>`.
- Renamed PrimaryAxis to AxisY and SecondaryAxis to AxisX.
- Visual update to animations and default colors so charts by default are more beautiful now :)

**Migration from previous versions**
- Chage all `ObservableCollection<double>` to `ChartValues<double>`, this will help you to run the code, but also concider reading the new documentation since LiveCharts is more powerful now.
- Change `ObservableCollection<Series>` to `SeriesCollection`
- Change PrimaryValues to Values
- Remove SecondaryValues from ScatterCharts, and set the values of ScatterSeries to `ChartValues<Point>`, or in line charting new XAML syntax  `Values="[0, 0], [45, .7071], [90, 1]"`
- Rename PrimaryAxis to AxisY and SecondaryAxis to AxisX
- you can safely remove XAML SeriesCollection wrapper from previous verison

all examples are uptated for 0.6

name: 0.5.10 More improvements to Mvvm pattern
body:
Fixed #67 and Improvements to #59 and #54.

**Before installing this version make sure that you updated your XAML as indicated in [0.5.9 release notes](https://github.com/beto-rodriguez/Live-Charts/releases/tag/0.5.9)**

name: 0.5.9  Better Mvvm support!
body:
Fixed many Mvvm bugs, reported in #54, #59.

Before Installing 0.5.9  you could need to make some changes to your XAML, where you used this sintax:

**From**

``` xml
<liveCharts:LineChart Name="Chart" Grid.Row="1" Grid.Column="0">
            <liveCharts:LineChart.Series>
                    <liveCharts:LineSeries Title="Maria" PrimaryValues="20, 40, 45, 60, 55, 60, 65, 70" />
                    <liveCharts:LineSeries Title="John" PrimaryValues="30, 35, 43, 68, 65 ,70, 55, 60" />
            </liveCharts:LineChart.Series>
        </liveCharts:LineChart>
```

**To**

``` xml
<liveCharts:LineChart Name="Chart" Grid.Row="1" Grid.Column="0">
            <liveCharts:LineChart.Series>
                <liveCharts:SeriesCollection>
                    <liveCharts:LineSeries Title="Maria" PrimaryValues="20, 40, 45, 60, 55, 60, 65, 70" />
                    <liveCharts:LineSeries Title="John" PrimaryValues="30, 35, 43, 68, 65 ,70, 55, 60" />
                </liveCharts:SeriesCollection>
            </liveCharts:LineChart.Series>
        </liveCharts:LineChart>
```

Notice the new `SeriesCollection` wrapper, it is nothing but a class that inherits from `ObservableCollection<Series>`, we need to hard code this instance so wpf can track each chart `Series` correctly.

- Fixed multi type charts hover bugs
- Fill and Stroke for line and bar charts are supported now

- Fixed designer mode bugs
- Now you can customize Storke and Fill color in bar charts
fixed line area bug

- Tooltip can be easly replaced and its animated.
- Fixed typo errors changed names from serie to series
- bar and stacked bar charts support line series now

name: 0.5 Best version so far
body:
-  Full support for MVVM
-  Changed All objects to the same namespace
-  Introduced Performance Optimization, for now it is only tested in line Chart, it is able to plot 1,000,000 point in less than 30 ms
- Labels placement Improved

name: 0.4.1 Revision
body: Fixed #30

name: 0.4 Version
body:
- Added better behavior to `PieChart`
- Improved `SeriesViewers`
- Fixed many reported bugs

Added new Charts
- **Stacked Bar Chart**
- **Radar Chart**

More changes
- **Improved tooltip location in almost all charts**
- **Improved labels printing**
- **Improved Labels Formatters**

**Note:** Name space changed form **Charts** to **LiveCharts**
